Notes.Text:
This update for nodejs10 fixes the following issues:

- nodejs10 was updated to 10.22.1 LTS:
   - CVE-2020-8252: Fixed a buffer overflow in realpath (bsc#1176589).
   - CVE-2020-15095: Fixed an information leak through log files (bsc#1173937).
- Explicitly add -fno-strict-aliasing to CFLAGS to fix compilation
  on Aarch64 with gcc10 (bsc#1172686)

Vulnerabilities.Description: Versions of the npm CLI prior to 6.14.6 are vulnerable to an information exposure vulnerability through log files. The CLI supports URLs like "<protocol>://[<user>[:<password>]@]<hostname>[:<port>][:][/]<path>". The password value is not redacted and is printed to stdout and also to any generated log files.

Vulnerabilities.Description: The implementation of realpath in libuv < 10.22.1, < 12.18.4, and < 14.9.0 used within Node.js incorrectly determined the buffer size which can result in a buffer overflow if the resolved path is longer than 256 bytes.
